title: Album Page, "Sketch of Trophy with Banners and Weapons of Battle", late 19th century
medium: Graphite on thick, off-white wove paper with deckled edges, folded and tipped into binding with fabric
markings: Watermark: left side of sheet: C inscribed in shield;  right side of sheet: six-pointed star / De More (?)
inscribed: Recto, in graphite, bottom right corner of drawing: shield; center left side of drawing: champ. . .(?) cuirass; above left of previous inscription: shield. Verso, in graphite, left face of sheet (as bound), upper right corner: 116; bottom right corner: 108; interior right face (as bound), bottom right corner: 109;
dimensions: Sheet: 60 x 42 cm (23 5/8 x 16 9/16 in.), irregular
description: Vertical sheet that has been folded and tipped into binding depicting a large sketch of a trophy of battle.  The trophy is comprised of a shield at center surmounted by a helmet, and composed of other shields and curasses around the lower perimeter.  Arranged above and projecting from behind the shield are banners, halberds, an axe and a sword.

tombstone.epitaph: Album Page, "Sketch of Trophy with Banners and Weapons of Battle", late 19th century.Graphite on thick, off-white wove paper with deckled edges, folded and tipped into binding with fabric. Gift of Mrs. William Greenough. 1943-51-281.
